column6: Process to determine material topics
column13: Each year, BHP identifies the sustainability topics most material to its business partners and stakeholders. These considerations inform BHP's approach to sustainability. In alignment with the recommendations of the GRI, BHP considers its business's actual and potential negative and positive impacts to determine its material sustainability topics. As part of the assessment, BHP considered a broad range of inputs, including BHP's group priority and emerging risks, information recorded in the internal event management system, social value framework, and insights from interviews with senior leaders and subject matter experts across the business.

column13: The strength of BHP's portfolio, operating excellence and financial rigour from the disciplined application of the Capital Allocation Framework (CAF) have helped BHP deliver strong and consistent returns. BHP achieved a net operating cash flow of US$18.7 billion in FY2023. BHP's net operating cash flow has been above US$15 billion for 13 of the last 14 years. In FY2023, through CAF, BHP kept its balance sheet strong, delivered growth and returns for shareholders, made progress towards its social value and GHG emissions reduction objectives and prioritised capital to maintain reliable operation.

column13: BHP delivered 40 kilotonnes of coal at BMA through the Process Area Set Point Optimisation (PASPO) digital tool in FY2023. column13: BHP's Jansen Potash Project in Saskatchewan, Canada, is anticipated to provide a rich source of potassium for fertiliser to improve agricultural production. The BHP Board approved the C$7.5 billion Jansen Stage 1 project in August 2021. Stage 1 is currently under construction and is expected to start production in late CY2026 and ramp-up to full production in CY2028, with a capacity of up to 4.35 Mt of potash per annum. A feasibility study to explore Stage 2 is also underway and expected to be completed in FY2024. If approved, Stage 2 would increase the capacity of the mine.
